publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4632# Maureen Macmillan: Elgin Bypass—That the Parliament notes the continued strong public support for an Elgin bypass; believes that a bypass is necessary to relieve the increasing problem of congestion in and around Elgin; welcomes the Moray 2020 strategy which recognises that, in order to enhance the area to attract inward investment, government dispersals and growing businesses, local transport links need to be transformed, and therefore believes that both Moray Council and the Scottish Executive should give a commitment to re-examine the case for an Elgin bypass.
S2M-4632# Elgin Bypass (lodged on 27 June 2006) Richard Lochhead*, Trish Godman*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Nora Radcliffe*, Dave Petrie*, Mr David Davidson*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Helen Eadie*, Brian Adam*
S2M-4632# Elgin Bypass (lodged on 27 June 2006) Ms Maureen Watt*

S2M-4632# Maureen Macmillan: Elgin Bypass—That the Parliament notes the continued strong public support for an Elgin bypass; believes that a bypass is necessary to relieve the increasing problem of congestion in and around Elgin; welcomes the Moray 2020 strategy which recognises that, in order to enhance the area to attract inward investment, government dispersals and growing businesses, local transport links need to be transformed, and therefore believes that both Moray Council and the Scottish Executive should give a commitment to re-examine the case for an Elgin bypass. Supported by: Richard Lochhead, Trish Godman, Mr Frank McAveety, Nora Radcliffe, Dave Petrie, Mr David Davidson, Mrs Nanette Milne, Helen Eadie, Brian Adam, Ms Maureen Watt, Stewart Stevenson*
S2M-4632# Elgin Bypass (lodged on 27 June 2006) Richard Baker*
S2M-4632# Elgin Bypass (lodged on 27 June 2006) Marlyn Glen*

S2M-4632# Maureen Macmillan: Elgin Bypass—That the Parliament notes the continued strong public support for an Elgin bypass; believes that a bypass is necessary to relieve the increasing problem of congestion in and around Elgin; welcomes the Moray 2020 strategy which recognises that, in order to enhance the area to attract inward investment, government dispersals and growing businesses, local transport links need to be transformed, and therefore believes that both Moray Council and the Scottish Executive should give a commitment to re-examine the case for an Elgin bypass. Supported by: Richard Lochhead, Trish Godman, Mr Frank McAveety, Nora Radcliffe, Dave Petrie, Mr David Davidson, Mrs Nanette Milne, Helen Eadie, Brian Adam, Ms Maureen Watt, Stewart Stevenson, Richard Baker, Marlyn Glen Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support
S2M-4632# Elgin Bypass (lodged on 27 June 2006) Dr Jean Turner*
